Example Programs

Several example programs are provided with the SPMIDI SDK. Most of these examples rely on the functions in "spmidi_util.c" and "spmidi_play.c". The simplest example, and a good starting point for experimentation is "play_scale.c".
checksum_player.c Renders a MIDI file but does not play it. It just calculates a checksum. This is useful for benchmarking on low level systems.
minimal_player.c Minimal example recommended as a starting point for playing MIDI files on embedded systems. It loads its MIDI file from a 'C' char array.
playmf.c This complex example plays a MIDIFile interactively. You can hit keys to pause and resume playback, mute channels, print internal status, etcetera. For a simpler example see "play_midifile.c" below.
play_all_programs.c Play all 128 of the General MIDI melody instruments.
play_bend.c Play notes with pitch bend.
play_chords.c Play several notes simultaneously.
play_drums.c Play all of the General MIDI rhythm instruments.
play_midifile.c Play a standard MIDI file.
play_programs.c Play selected programs. Used for debugging specific instruments.
play_scale.c Play several notes in a scale.
play_song.c Play a song that can be either an SMF file or a Mobile XMF file.
play_vibrator.c Define a callback function for the Vibrator callback defined for mobile phones. This shows how to play the phone vibrations embedded in some songs.
print_midifile.c Use the MIDIFile parser to print the contents of a MIDI file. Useful for diagnosing problems in a MIDI file.
play_song.c Use the ME3000 PlaySong API to play a MIDI or XMF file.
